items.title: TOC
items.text: Lorem ipsum

items.title: Who we are
items.text:
We are a South African based start-up, giving a new and exciting spin on the modern urban requirements of DIY biltong making. Our range of products have been specifically designed and selected for you to showcase your efforts: as a conversation piece, in your living space or on your bar counter.

The dryness of biltong is now measurable by using the revolutionary patented BB Brain Box and App. Whether you like it

  • very wet;
  • wet;
  • medium;
  • dry; and
  • bone dry

you can dry your biltong to perfection each time in our bespoke driers- thus our slogan

Dried to your liking!

items.title: Understanding what BB1 does!
items.text:
The Bespoke Biltong Brain Box (BB1) is an intelligent microprocessor controlled biltong dryness indicator. It is a patented and innovative device to get continuous feedback of the dryness/wetness of your prime piece of biltong.

The BB1 unit is fitted with LEDs to indicate 5 levels of dryness, much like the levels of doneness of steak. This is a first of its kind to quantify the dryness/wetness of biltong so that you can make an informed decision as to what moisture level you prefer your biltong to be dried to.

To enhance your experience with your piece of biltong and bring the “technology meets tradition” into play, the BB1 Brain Box comes with a mobile application that can be downloaded and installed on your mobile from the Google Play Store or Apple App Store.

The mobile App will provide visualization of the biltong drying process through a graphical interface on your mobile, and guides you through the operating sequences of the BB1 unit. If the application is used, the following information is displayed on your mobile phone:

  • Dryness factor %
  • Temperature in degrees C
  • Humidity %
  • Initial Weight (g)
  • Current Weight (g)
  • Cut-off weight (g)
  • Historical weight as it dries

items.title: System health check
items.text:
BB1’s diagnostics of its interconnected systems. On power up BB1 does a diagnostic test on all of its internal Systems and indicates the status of these systems on the LED’s. This is to make sure that you as the user can check that everything is working correctly.

  1. Humidity and Temperature sensor
    1. Green and white alternating LEDS indicate the Humidity and Temperature module is present and operational.
    2. Red and white alternating LEDS indicate that the Humidity and Temperature module is not operational or missing.
    3. The humidity & temperature sensor is an optional add on for BB1 and can be purchased separately.
  2. Light emitting diodes (LED’s)
    1. A running sequence of LEDs to check all colours that are required to be displayed on the LEDs. The sequence will display red, green, blue and white.
  3. Drying scale
    1. The internal scale which is representative of the dryness of the biltong will be checked to see if it is present and operational. If correct the LEDs will flash twice green to indicate that the scale is operational.
    2. If the scale is not operating, the system will check a number of times and if no response is received, LED 1, 3 & 5 will be white and constantly on. This shows that the scale is not working and the system will freeze in this state as it can’t operate without the scale being operational. Please contact Bespoke Biltong for assistance.
  4. Voltage conditioning
    1. The internal voltage bus of BB1 is regulated at 3.3V DC. This is monitored to make sure that the power supply is operational and regulating at the correct voltage. This feature will only be visible when using the “mobile app” as the voltage and status of the voltage will be displayed on the “mobile app” only.
  5. Memory status
    1. BB1 will determine how much of the internal memory has been used and indicate on the “mobile app” the percentage used.

items.title: What's in the box
items.text:
1. In the box
    • Bespoke Biltong Dryness Scale (BB1).
    • Power cable to plug into the distribution board on the BB1 and BB3 driers.
  2. Unboxing and connecting the power supply
    1. Place the BB1 unit on your dryer of choice.
    2. Use the supplied power cable to connect to the Micro USB connector on the right hand side of the BB1 unit.
    3. Connect the standard USB connector side to a 5V USB type charger that can deliver at least 0.3A.

items.title: Powering up
items.text:
Switching on the power for the first time, or when powering up or recovering from a power failure BB1 will behave differently depending on whether the mobile app (RemoteXY) is connected. In both cases switch on the power by connecting the supplied cable or any other Micro USB type cable to BB1 and connecting to the USB outlet (5V).

  1. Powering up BB1 and loading a new piece of Biltong (without the mobile app)
    1. Load new meat and when done, press the button, BB1 will perform initial calculations and all LEDS will be on and red to indicate that the process has started and that the moisture is at maximum.
    2. The system is now configured and running.
    3. No more action required.
  2. Powering up BB1 without loading new biltong (without the mobile app)
    1. The Lowest LED on BB1 will flash at a 1 second rate (WHITE).
    2. BB1 will continue to flash for 1 minute, during this time do nothing as the system must powerup and continue with the process after the power failure.
    3. After a minute of no action, BB1 will enter andperform the system checks as described in system health checks and then display current dryness on the LEDS.
    4. Essentially, no action is required as this is how it will recover from a power failure.
    5. BB1 will however reload all stored parameters and continue with the drying cycle as if uninterrupted.
  3. Powering up BB1 with the mobile app (App will provide all the instructions) Powering up and loading new/fresh piece of biltong
    1. The Lowest LED on BB1 will flash at a 1 second rate (WHITE).
    2. Open the mobile App (refer to instructions on how to load and configure mobile app).
    3. The message will be displayed on the Mobile App that the button must be pressed to load new meat.
    4. BB1 will continue to flash for 1 minute, during this time press the touch sensitive button on BB1 or the button on the mobile app to indicate that a new/fresh piece of meat is to be loaded onto BB1. The button/s must be pressed during this 1-minute interval, otherwise BB1 will enter normal power up mode and continue without providing the opportunity to load a new/fresh piece of meat on power up.
    5. Once the button is pressed during the 1-minute interval, BB1 will switch on the lowest LED (white) and display New meat selected Press to continue on the app. Press the button on the app or on BB1 to continue with the process which will go into the “System health Check” to check if all systems are working and then continue with the loading routine.
